title: Liam Payne says One Direction left him on verge of madness and would have killed him
text:

Liam Payne says One Direction would have killed him if they hadn't gone on hiatus.

The band formed on X Factor in 2010, when Liam, Harry Styles, Louis Tomlinson, Zayn Malik and Niall Horan auditioned as solo artists.

They went on to huge worldwide success before Zayn quit in 2015, and the rest of the group decided to take a break the following year.

And Liam, 26, who says at one point he was drinking so much that he no longer recognised himself, thinks the band would have killed him in the end.

Speaking on podcast Table Manners with Jessie Ware , he said: "I went through a stage in the band when I was drinking really heavily - I put weight on and didn't notice.

(Image: PA)

(Image: 2014 Getty Images)

"I was just really drunk every day. I didn't see what was looking back at me in the mirror.

"Eventually I saw a pap shot and was surprised I'd become that guy. I'm glad it happened, it was worth it to make me realise what life's made of."

He added: "I used to just get wasted and say whatever I wanted.

"Our time schedule was just a mess, I used to get off stage, high off the endorphins and get horrendously drunk, get up at 5 in the afternoon and do it all over again.

"We'd write the album in two weeks, it was crazy, they used to sell the tour before we'd written the albums, they'd be like, 'We've sold the stadiums...'"

(Image: PA)

(Image: ITV)

Liam, who shares two-year-old son Bear with ex Cheryl, also said there was no child protection for him and his bandmates despite their young age.

Liam, who was 17 when he left X Factor and embarked on his career, said: "They don't get it [child protection] for you as you are considered lucky to be there because it's the job you wanted to do.

"It was so boring when all you see is hotel rooms.

"I learned to become a recluse a long time, and one you get in that pattern it's dangerous 'cause you get stuck in it."

He added: "I was going through this crazy circumstance. We were definitely over-worked, 100 percent in the band, we had no personal life, I learned nothing about myself.

(Image: Rex)

"I remember getting to therapy and the guy was like, 'What do you like to do?' and I didn't know. I just sat in the chair and was like, 'I don't know'.

"I just lived so long as their reclusive pop star who was afraid of people, who just stayed inside all the time."

Liam was asked if he was relieved when the band came to an end.

He said: "Not a relief, it was scary at the time but I needed to stop. It would have killed me."
